bibl.title: The Codex and Literacy in Early Christianity and at Oxyrhynchus: Issues Raised by Harry Y. Gamble's Books and Readers in the Early Church.

series.title: Critical Review of Books in Religion

bibl.note: Discusses: Harry Y. GAMBLE, Books and Readers in the Early Church: A History of Early Christian Texts (New Haven - London, 1995). - I. The Codex Format and Its Christian Use: A. Previous Explanations for the Christian Adoption of the Codex: Roberts and Skeat; - B. Gamble's Explanation for the Christian Adoption of the Codex; - C. Alternative Views on the Christian Adoption of the Codex. - II. Literacy and Literary Criticism: A. Oxyrhynchus as a Test Case; - B. Classical Writings at Oxyrhynchus and Literacy; - C. Christian Literature at Oxyrhynchus and Literacy; - D. Literary Criticism at Oxyrhynchus.
